solution:
Substituting the values for $\mathbf{v}$ and the corresponding values for $\mathbf{F}/q$ into

$$\frac{\mathbf{F}}{q} = \mathbf{v}\times\mathbf{B}$$

and solving directly for the components of $\mathbf{B}$ gives

$$
\begin{split}
B_x &= 1 \\
B_y &= 2 \\
B_z &= 4
\end{split}
$$
statement: The magnetic induction $\mathbf{B}$ is defined by the Lorentz force equation, $$\mathbf{F} = q \, (\mathbf{v}\times\mathbf{B})$$ Carrying out three experiments, we find that if $\mathbf{v}=\hat{\mathbf{x}}$, $$\frac{\mathbf{F}}{q} = 2\hat{\mathbf{z}} - 4\hat{\mathbf{y}}$$ $\mathbf{v}=\hat{\mathbf{y}}$, $$\frac{\mathbf{F}}{q} = 4\hat{\mathbf{x}} - \hat{\mathbf{z}}$$ $\mathbf{v}=\hat{\mathbf{z}}$, $$\frac{\mathbf{F}}{q} = \hat{\mathbf{y}} - 2\hat{\mathbf{x}}$$ From the results of these three separate experiments calculated the magnetic induction $\mathbf{B}$.
author: Arfken & Weber
